benchmark_details.name: CAT-B ENCH
benchmark_details.overview: CAT-B ENCH is a benchmark of Step Order Prediction questions, designed to evaluate how well large language models (LLMs) understand causal and temporal dependencies in cooking recipe plans.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the causal and temporal reasoning abilities of large language models (LLMs) over instructional plans.

data.source: Modified Recipe Flow Graph Corpus containing cooking recipes annotated with substep procedure dependencies.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated as per standard definitions in model evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better understanding of causal and temporal dependencies.
methodology.baseline_results: Best zero-shot F1 of 0.59, with improvements using explanation-based generation yielding up to 0.73 F1.
methodology.validation: Model performance validated through human evaluation and automated metrics.
